text: Klares, rötliches Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, Karamell, leicht nussig, etwas fruchtig, Zitrusfrüchte, Orangen.

330 ml bottle bought at HK Brewcraft in Tsim Sha Tsui.
Looks: Clear amber red colour; One finger head with crumpety light beige foam which lasts for 3 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with quite fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant full Ale malt, with strong caramel, rich toffee, citrus peels, light tangerines, floral, strong molasses, pine, strong resins, spices, earth, biscuit, lemon and grass.

Taste: Close to medium sweet strong Amber malt, with grapefruits, strong caramel, toffee, strong floral, molasses, pine, strong resins, spices, strong herbs, dry biscuits, strong lemon, very strong bitter hops and grass.

Body: Full body; Thick and very oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: Quite rich Amber maltyness in a thick background, smoothness is oat-like. Strong oozy hoppiness dominates throughout, with pine, grapefruits, spices and strong herbs to compliment solid caramel and toffee. Flowery with just right sweetness. Biscuity with strong lemon to round. Very good!

Hoppiness: Citrus peels, light tangerines, floral, pine, strong resins, spices, earth, lemon and grass in nose. Grapefruits, strong floral, pine, strong resins, spices, strong herbs, strong lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness is very strong for a lasting, more than high astringent bitter-sweet herbal malty finish.

After taste: Quite dry. Oozy, spicy and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: Its Amber maltyness is rich already, with rock solid IPA style resiny citrus hoppiness for a well-balanced tasting sensation. A damn good English-style red IPA!
Pours a red colour. Taste is quite fruity dry and hoppy on the palate. A very good beer

On tap at Vrteka. Thanks... someone... :D Clear amber body, off white head that went away fast. Oily malty aroma, light tangerine. Light malty taste, vague flowery and citric hoppy undertones. Yeah, not an IRA, closer to an Amber Ale. But meh however you put it.

Draft 0.15l at Craft & Draft Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 04.04.2017. Taste with kermis. Pour it amber color with small white head. Aroma peanuts and herbal hoppy feel. Taste nice red blood oranges, grapefruit, sweet, smooth creamy texture, medium to full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter pleasent finish.

Roja cobriza, muy bonita en copa. Aunque no estaba en toda su plenitud, buen equilibrio entre maltas, caramelo, afrutados y resinosos. Cuerpo medio y sabroso, de sabor caramelizado y con las notas tan características del simcoe en un final resinoso y especiado con postgusto otra vez maltosa. Chula!

Amber red colour with nice head that left beautiful lacing as it dissolved. Aroma has caramel malts, raisin and dried fruits, pines and grass hops too. Taste is sweet with caramel malts, raisin, ends with pines and grass hops. Medium body and medium carbonation. Way too much caramel malts for me, maybe the hops have disappeared already, who knows.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Color ámbar casi marrón, rojizo si le da la luz, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (poca retención). Carbonatación media. Textura acuosa. Aroma a cítricos, resina y caramelo. Sabor frutal, algo cítrico, resinoso, con buena dosis de malta caramelizada que hace presencia a mitad de trago y sobre todo en regusto. Quizá hay algo que remite a fruto seco, o quizá solo sea yo. Amargor medio tirando a suave que se acentúa mínimamente en postgusto. Seca. Me hubiera gustado probarla fresca de verdad, debe de ser más que buena.

7/20 quite a bland IPA with a bit too much bitterness for me. Not much taste other than the bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Craft & Draft. Hazy amber brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, resinous hops and fruity hops. Flavour is above moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with a resinous juicy hop coating palate and soft carbonation.
On tap at BBF. Copper colour with off white head. Hoppy and caramel aroma. Bitter, caramel, hoppy, resin taste. Medium body.

Tasted from the tap on the 28/03/2017. Deep red brown colour with a medium tan head. Aroma of caramel, malts and some liquorice. Taste of caramel, malts and some fruits. Malty finish. Next one please!
Clear brown colour with lasting head. Aroma and flavour have loads of floral notes and sweet malts.
POTduft in your Nose. Amberkupferhopfentrunk after this!!; uiuiuui. Very dry, very redfruitlastig und üppigst gelungen. Love!! 0,2. Tap. BREWDOG BERLIN.

0.33l bottle. Dark amber color with medium white good lasting head. Aroma: grapefruit, lime, caramel, candies. Taste: rich taste of caramel, resins and grapefruit, hint of coffee. Medium body, moderate carbonation. High bitterness.

33cl bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring. An attractive reddish copper colour with a thick, pale caramel coloured head; well balanced with a fruity, malty, caramel body and a resinous, piney bitterness; then some citrus and spice leading to a drier finish with lingering candied peel. Outstanding.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, orange, bread, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/dark brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and orange; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Good beer overall and even more so for its style. Feels like there is a bit too much yeast, because it is slightly too balanced. Both the malts and the hops could have been more bombastic. Thanks to this the aroma could have been stronger and the finish less dominated by bread.
500ml bottle pours a copper color with a bit of head. Lots of maltiness and nice balance of hops.

Cask at Casc Aberdeen. Pours a dark red brown with a frothy head that fades leaving nice lacing. Aromas of fresh liquorice, toffee and slight herb. Flavour is roasted malts, citrus fruits and fudge. Leaves a nice biscuit linger.
Keg at Barbridge, Stourbridge. Pours deep red brown with a small head. Aroma is mango jelly and toast. Taste has red fruits and toast. Burnt finish.

33cl bottle shared at home. Somewhat pale amber with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with subtle fruity tones. Caramel, red fruit, pine, malts and grapefruit. Nice!

330ml bottle. Clear dark amber pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma: fruity hops, malt, caramel, grapefruit, citrus. Taste: nice malty backbone, caramel, good hit of fruity citrus hops, grapefruit, tropical fruit. Well balanced. Bitter piney finish. Smooth mouthfeel, medium body and carbonation. Not a big fan of this style but this is an outstanding example.
On tap at craft beer calling 2016. Hop aromatics and taste were nice, alcohol a bit highly present, malt was overly burnt caramel and made the brew unbalanced.

Haf one at Hair of the dog, Bangkok.
Roasty, malty, caramel, fruity. a bit bitter, easy drinking.

500 ml bottle from Hawthorne Cellars. Slightly hoppy, slightly sweet aroma. Pours amber with medium tan head. Flavour has a malty backbone with good amount of hops. Balanced. Well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from World Beer Market. Pours a deep red-brown with ruby highlights, nice beige head and lacing. Good aroma of pine and caramel, some raspberry jubes, citrus and grapefruit. Similar flavour too, really nicely balanced for a red ale, good citrus with just the right amount of sweetness and caramel. Big bitter finish, pine resin. I had this a few years back and it felt of that time this time around. Not dated, just when pine and caramel were king and not everything was tropical. Great beer.

500ml bottle. Pours copper with fluffy white head. Aroma is caramel, biscuits, spice and some red fruits. Flavour is strawberry and orange up front, then some spiced sweet biscuits. Finish is dry, spice and lingering bitterness. This is an exceptional beer, in a style Im not normally too excited by.

A 330ml bottle from batch # 65 with a best before date of 25th January 2017, poured into a Moonzen teku glass. It poured a clear brown colour with a reddish hue and a just over one finger beige head that had good retention and left nice lacing. Aromas were strong caramel malt notes with some dark fruits like plum, prunes and raisins. There was also a touch of pine and earthiness. Taste had a touch of booziness hit first followed by everything in the aromas. Caramel, dark fruit, prunes, plum and raisins. The finish gave a touch of tea, coffee, pine and citrus. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall it felt more amber ale than IPA in my opinion. But it was overly boozy and caramel-ly on both aroma and taste for me to fully enjoy it.

Had across NZ on tap and bottles at many a sunset. Caramel malt with lots of juicy hops -- tropical fruit like mango and faintly resinous. The juicy hop character is just outstanding on this one. My favorite amber ale. Exceptional take on this style.
Bottle at home. Nice little hop bite, caramel flavour with semi-sweet finish. Medium bodied. Quite enjoyable :)

Bottle from eDrinks in Tallinn,  4.38. BB scraped off? July something. Pours clear dark amber with creamy frothy head. Aroma of sweet, jammy and caramelly malts, plus herbal-resiny hops, orange peel esters. Tastes thick malty sweet upfront, continuing with resiny citrus peel hoppiness. Juicy. Soft on the palate, thin crispish carbonation, firm medium body. Lovely brew!

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 Colore ambra rubino, molto scuro, schiuma abbastanza persistente e vaporosa. Splendido aroma di malto, caramello, frutta esotica, una punta erbacea. Bevuta davvero notevole, con un corpo medio anche se è piuttosto beverina, carbonazione medio bassa. Ancora malto e caramello, con un finale amaro lungo che rende il tutto piacevole.
Tap at Freehouse Singapore. Pours light coca-cola like brown with a creamy light-brown head. Aroma is weak caramel. Taste is caramel sweet, earthy hop bitter, oak, leather.

Ruby transparrent red colour. Medium white head. Fruits, hints of berries, hints of citrusses in the aroma. Hints of apricots, hints of tea, fruits. Bitter, fruity finish. Citrusses in aftertaste. Well balanced, rather light bodied, well drinkable amber ale.

Meh, red body with some modest head, you wouldnt recognize it out of a crowd. Weird caramel and throat lozenge aroma, like you turned the tap water on in your kitchen sink and it was all copper-ish... wet dog hair, thats what it smells like. Flavour is a lot of sharp caramel and barley notes, pumpernickel, heavy molasses, a bit of hops... but kind of a mess, really. Not bad but kind of a mixed bag. Not a delight, a bit of a working thing to get through to say you did it.

Bottle fom the Hop Hideout in Sheffield. Ppurs deep amber with a nice foamy cream head. Nice aroma with caramel and orange. The taste is lightly spicy with orange and clove, mango and caramel. Nice full flavour. Creamy mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Deep amber almost brown pour with a half a finger of head that lingers. Lots of juicy tropical fruit with some grapefruit and light pine and caramel on the nose. The tropical fruit really sets this apart from so many regular IRA / ambers. Extemely well-balanced with good caramel malt notes on the palate. Juicy mango and peach on the finish with some pine and grass. Another winner from 8 Wired.

Excellent beer, not overpoweringly hoppy but nicely complex. From New Zealand only adds to the pleasure!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from hop hideout. Auburn with small head. Aroma is caramel and pine, a hint of lemon and orange zest. Taste savoury and and bitter. Prickly and medium. Nice.

7%ABV. Red Ale.

Tapped out a red amber. 18ºSRM.

Nose has nice sweet grain alcoholic aromas. There is brown sugar and some spice, maybe nutmeg.

Mouthfeel is soapy. There are roasty malt flavors with some molasses, dark honey, sweet graham cracker toast, burnt caramel. The hops are pine needles, sap, light resinous flavor, spicy finish like Thai basil with that same slightly cloying medicinal finish. This actually tastes like fresh hyssop. 

Good brief-medium fresh herb finish. 
Goes on Favorites List!

Poured a clear dark red-brown colour with about 5mm of beige foam that diminished slowly to a collar that laced OK. Carbonation extremely low (almost nil) and medium sized. Aroma strongly of hop resin/pine with hints of dark fruits, citrus and a trace of sweet dark caramel malt. Taste initially of sweet caramel that was immediately over-taken by an intense but nice bitterness plus hints of dark fruits, pine and roasted malt; alcohol unfortunately not well hidden. Light body. Smooth with a soft creamy mouthfeel and a lingering bitterness but the alcohol burns on the finish. The alcohol coming through was disappointing and let the overall quality of the beer down.

BOTTLE. Pours red with a golden tinge, small off white head.. Big sweet malty nose with minimal hops.. Huge malty red for sure, good toffee & caramel malt sweetness with a hoppy bitterness in the initial taste.. Sourced Cape Cellars

Pours clear, deep copper with low off-white head. Aroma of caramel, resin, light grapefruit, hints of rye. Taste is initial bitter, followed by a balancing caramel sweetness, before a lingering big bitterness. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

Cest une sorte de brune rougeoyante ... Couleur caramel. Elle est bien crémeuse. Nette et bien exécutée. Assez courte, mais décidément japprécie de plus en plus "8 wired". En tout cas, cest passé tout seul ...
Red ale, ipa. Take the 2, smash them together. Pure fusion. It works, malty hoppy, good.

roasty, caramel, bread, coffee, resin, clear, red, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, 
le nez est dune richesse extraordinaire, je retrouve des fruits rouges, les épices douces. crémeuse voir duveteuse elle laisse une petite sucrosité sans lourdeur. bien équilibré dans la richesse.
Last bottle on New Zealand. What a finish! Well balanced, fruity, hoppy, medium sweet and medium bitter.

bottle . deep amber color, malty, fully lasting, floral hop, hoppy ,caramel, medium body .. good

어두운 호박색 몰티한 향. 호피함과 적절한 탄산감 내가 좋아하는 밸런스.지속력& 나쁘지않음.

Deep amber with a medium white head. Nice aroma of caramel, brown sugar, fruits and hops. Tastes medium bitter, with lot of fruit, caramel malts and hops. Very hoppy for its style, a very original beer, born from an amber ale and an IPA. Very tasty.

On tap at Mill on Constance, Fortitude Valley (charity event for brewers kettle explosion). Pours ruby red with nice frothy head. An excellent mix of bitter and sweet notes on the nose and the palate. My kind of beer, its a meal in a glass. Hang in there fine Gents!
Tap at roundhouse, hong kong. Deep copper color, white head. Hoppy aroma has sweetness and fruits. Smooth palate has lots of hops, fruity notes, some sweet caramel notes.

Clear deep nutty color with a thich tan head. Nice lacing. Powerful aroma and flavor in this one. Lots of grapefruit, bready and fruity. Maybe a bit to sweet for my likings. Still a decent and powerful ale.[Bottle at Apotekergaarden in Grimstad, Norway]

Bottle, Ale House. 

Huge hop aroma. Finnish rye bread aroma. Forest dew. Taste is lemons, Finnish rye bread, creamy finish and big hops. Clean. Juicy. Really well-made.
Aroma is of sweet apples and brown sugar. Flavour retains the brown sugar but adds the perfect balance of bitterness. The mouthfeel is round and substantial.

Aroma: very intense floral hops, pine, straw, pale malts. Appearance: hazy amber, medium, off-white, frothy head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: some sweetness coming up, caramel, light exotic fruits, soft carbonation, pale malts, floral hops coming up, turns quite bitter and dry in the finish. Overall: excellent Amber Ale, quite complex aroma and palate. Bottle from Twenty One Wines, Brighton.

Aroma is boozy and malty. Not much hop aroma coming through - maybe the bottles a little old. Looks a beautiful clear red in glass. Taste is biscuity, boozy and grassy bitter; not particularly hop flavoured. Finish is medium with low carbonation. A good drop but I prefer a slightly lower ABV, less bitter in a Amber/red coloured Ale

On tap at Steins in Mountain View. Aroma was rich malt and slight hops. Pours clear amber with off-white head that was moderately sustained. Taste is malt dominated - biscuit. I did not get a lot of hop flavor or aroma, just a moderate bitterness.

50 cl bottle. Dark red with copper and excellent foam. Aroma: fruits, a little citrus and pine, honey candy with caramel and toffee. Taste: caramel, biscuit with jam, syrup and sliced ​​fruits, good bitterness with earth and pine.

Pours a small frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is clear red brown. Aroma contains moderate malts (dark bread, cookie, grain, molasses), moderate hops (flowers, perfume, resin, ciyrus fruits), light yeasts (horse blanket) and banana, raisin, grape, apple, peach, cherry, raspberry and forest fruits.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and sweet, followed by light acidic, sweet and bitter. Next is sweet and bitter and finish is bitter.
Body is medium to full with creamy to syrupy texture and soft carbonation.
Loaded with hoppy and sweet malty fruits, with a sharp bitterness in the finish. Contains the good of hops and malts while still being quite in balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark red with a small beige head with short retention. I cant recall a more room-filling, literally, aroma from a beer. Hops, sweetness, caramel. Really raised my expectations, and they were met! Each mouthful is a pleasure. Perfect, low carbonation for a beer of this kind giving an almost creamy palate. The hoppiness is certainly there, but this is also oh so round and balanced with taste of orange peel and grapefruit on the citrus front and caramel, malt, chocolate and liqourice(yes) on the rounder, sweeter side of the spectrum. The beauty is that it is not just interesting, it actually tastes bloody good! Truely a Grande Biere and one of the great positives so far this year as far as I am concerned. And then I notice that it is an ex-pat Dane brewing this in NZ! Søren, come home.....!:-)

Bottle 0,5l. Pours a clear ruby reddish deep amber colour with a short lived beige head. Aroma is apricot, homey, fruits, citrus and caramel. Flavor is loads of caramel, hops, alcohol and red berries. Finish is herbal. Medium body, weak to average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear ruby red, with a small, but dense, beige head. Aromas are ripened tropical fruits, spice cake, pine, and a chewy caramel. The taste is well-balanced, with a fresh fruitiness that complements the sweet flavours of the malt. The mouthfeel is slick and moderately effervescent.

Great beer, full bodied and good carbonation with really good flavour and alcohol weight, tasted nice and layered with lots of different flavours like christmas cake and spice but then sweetness and a bit of citrus. My new fave it has just kicked Epic Carolina off the top spot!!

Bottle. Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Clear, dark amber. Messy, thin, sticky, lasting, off white head. Lovely, ginger spice, brûléed grapefruit hop. Tastes chewy sweet. Spicy dry. Fruity, zesty bitter. Smooth, full, creamy, lightly chewy palate. Finishes long, clean, oily, spicy bitter. Really tasty. Really easy drinking. Delightful.

500ml bottle. Color description unavailable. Big foamy head could be a result of the high temperature. Nose reminds me of autumn. Beautiful taste! I like. (Yup, thats probably my most unhelpful rating ever.)

500 ml bottle shared with the boys.Pours a clear ruby reddish deep amber with a short lived beige head. Aroma is fruits, citrus, caramel. Flavor is loads of caramel and red berries. Finish is herbal, some earthy notes. Lingering fruit and conifer sap, as well as some resin. Medium body, weak to average carbonation.

bottle shared by albatross, thanks mate! pours hazy dark golden, almost light brown, with a reviving light beige cap, leaving creamy lacing. sweetish spicy caramel maltiness, spicy cakeyness, toasted nuts, pine and its resin, mint, pepper. light carbonation, light to medium body - oily, almost balanced - slightly harsh - spicy-resinous finish. nicely executed.

Bottle, half litre. Great smell and combination. The hop's are greatly combined. The new Zealanders are great at the hoppy beers. Would recommend 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[6125-20140117] Bottle. Hearty toasted orange peel aroma. Hazy, dark orange brown body with a quick foamy white head. Bitter toasted orange peel flavour. Medium-full body is quite bitter. Tasty. (7/3+/8/4/16) 3.8
Overheard: "I didnt get the hometown bounce."
50cl bottle from cerveteca Lisboa. Color is brown red. Head is thin and persistent. High bitterness, some sweetness. Medium body. Slightly oily. Aroma is hoppy, herby, coffee, bubblegummy.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Dark amber, big creamy light tanned head. Smell of ripe fruits, dark malts, dark fruits, hint of spices, pine and resins. Medium sweet, fruity, more ripe fruits and dark malts blended nice together with woody and piny hops. Heavy bitter finish, alot of resins. This beer has a solid malt base with rich fruity flavors which works well with the hop bill. Excellent stuff

Beautiful clear ruby color with medium head. Tropical fruits, mango, but also ananas and pines. Good caramely malt backbone. Taste is a great balance between hops and caramel, finish is dry and bitter. Smooth carbonation. I personally like red ales, and this one is a great mixed style! 8wired continues to amaze me.
From the bottle at a tasting at Tap 66, Xiamen. Pours red brown with a white head. Aroma of pine and sticky toffee. Sweet finish with a little bitterness.
Bottle. Copper color. Very hoppy aroma. Taste is very hoppy as well, with a touch of amber and some caramely iron. Bitter and dry aftertaste. Nice beer.
Hoppy hoppy hoppy, Nice full bodied beer with a malty backbone. Good solid brew-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

In short: A nourishing, sweet and bitter burgundy ale. A bit harsh and heavy. Ok.
How: Bottle 500ml, consumed when probably not fresh enough... (but soon after I got the beer through private importation).
The look: Cloudy ruby-copper body topped by a large beige head with medium retention.
In long: The mostly hoppy nose is very resinous and very piney along with strong toasted notes. In mouth the beer has a thick foamy-yeasty texture with a very active carbonation. Taste is a bit harsh. There is a lot of toasted malts, plenty of caramel, a strong yeast presence, sweet berries jam, earthy old wood, fruits seeds, assertive piney bitterness, sticky resin. This is a tasty beer that is everything but refreshing, it is nourishing, heavy, aggressively bitter, rather sweet. Meh, not my thing, not sure why I bought this, I will now get someone to buy beers for me because Ive finally decided I cannot trust my own judgment, and now Im cannot decide if I can trust my lack of trust of my own judgement, this is the beginning of a long process.

Bottle as a gift. Pours reddish brown with medium fluffy head. Aroma is fruity hoppy, grassy, citrus. Taste is medium to heavy bitter, citrus again, some nice butter in taste, fruity. Medium body. Medium carbonation. I love that beer.

piwo poteznie gozkie w smaku. W aromacie nieco mniej ale chmiel tez sie wyczuwa. Kolor czerwono krwisty, ze srednia i malo trwala piana. Wytrawne i piekielne goryczkowe. Nieco w koncowce wyczuwalny alkohol

0,5 l bottle from Biervana BB 22.04.2015 
red-brown color, clear and with a creamy and fast disappearing tan foam head. 
Aroma is: caramel, cereal, nuts, spruce, citrus, herbs, medium sweetness, very bitter, full body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Clear red with tan head. Aroma is red fruits, caramel, citrus and some spice. Round and fruity palate. Aftertaste is round, sweet, caramel, bitter, hops and lingering fruity finish. Overall: Nice! Wished it was more fruity and less bitter.
Nydelig duft av rosin, krydder og noe honning. Fin rødlig kastanjebrun farge. Tynn hinne skum, noe heng langs kant. Fin fruktig smak med rosin og noe krydder.
Mørk brun farve med kremet beige skum. Lukt av grapefrukt og karamell. Smak av grapefrukt, karamell, kaffe og krydder. Vinmonopolet.
Beautiful colour. Caramel, plum on the nose. Bitterness is well balanced with the malt. A bit too sweet for me. Good body. Not too boozy

Clear mahogany brown color, beige head with good lacing. Biscuits and prunes nose, brown sugar, yeast, coffee. Roasted malt taste, brown sugar, citrus, resin, bitter finish. Medium body, soft to medium carbonation.

Bottle from Asahiya. Fruity nose, with caramel, and thick hop soup, and grass. Clear reddish/copper color, thin beige head. Caramel, with woddy and herbal notes, bread, and small spiced cookies. Medium body. Very nice, but a bit unfocused. Near barleywine-level caramel. Tasty.

En veldig god American Strong Ale fra "down under"
Mye humle, men samtidig balansert maltpreg. Dufter av grapefrukt, mango og karamell. 
Smaker grapefrukt, søt men samtidig bitter avsluttning. Lang ettersmak. En god favoritt!

How: Draught.
Where: Brewdog Shoreditch, London.
Appearance: Amber colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Caramel, hops, fruit, grapefruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, hops, grapefruit.

Crystal clear, deep ruby red body with a quite large, tan head with a long life-time, good lacing. Hoppy, malty, sweet and strong aroma of overripe tropical fruits including grapefruit and mango, orange marmalade, caramel and sweet red berries in the background. Very strong flavour of overripe tropical fruits, lots of grapefruit, caramel, both red and dark berries further behind and pine in the long finish. Moderate to light sweet taste and a quite heavy bitter finish. Smooth, crisp and refreshing on the palate, mid-bodied, moderate carbonation and a pronounced dryness in the finish. A lovely beer, perfect if you crave a DIPA but would like everything tuned down a couple of notches. 
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 3 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Bottle into pint glass. Pours a wicked looking deep red. Nice off white head. Aroma is of sweet malts and fruity hops. Taste is of rich caramel malts with some nice fruity notes from the hops. Great full bodied beer. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Dsrk copper to blood red body. Lots of tan head with a light red hue. Malt heavy nose, with some grapefruit and citrus. Medium to thick body. Some alcohol warmth. A tiny bit of grainy mouth feel. Malt, grapefruit, caramel flavour. Quite bitter.

Keg at Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm.  Hazy copper colour, small head. Grapefruity nose with a dash of caramel. Mid dry with solid body and firm mouthfeel. An harmonious mix of caramelly, bready malt and grapefruity hops, notes of cedar. Long balanced bitterness.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. Pours a deep caramel with a low off white head. Aromas of caramel, grapefruit, apple, peach, hay, toffee. Taste is caramel, apple, peach, grapefruit, toffee. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Pretty well balanced and drinkable.

Keg at Brewdog. Clear ruby red, still, small off-white head. Aroma is sweet caramel and vinegar notes. Body is medium, touch of carbonation. Taste is smooth malts, sweet caramel, slightly floral with a dry, straw-like finish.

Draught keg at Brewdog Camden. Real big spicy hop nose - with a hint of wet leaves & bonfires. Great mouthfeel again - lingering & chewy but not cloying - the Hopwired beers seem very good at that characteristic.

Pours a clean, dark red color with a creamy, light tan head that leaves great lacing. Aroma has a full caramel malt nose, light toasty malt with a robust hoppy nose. Hops comes through as an earthy bitterness. Flavor starts off with an earthy bitterness that moves into a sweet caramel malt flavor. Body is modest with a sugary, oily feeling. Overall a pretty good brew.

Bottle. Dark amber, reddish, hazelnutty brown, clear. Strong nutty caramels, some citrus, pines on nose. Med full body. Light sweet, caramels. Piney hops, some herbs, earthyness. Very clean and easy drink. Just as powerful as youd expect a beer of this abv. Sort of autumny, with the pines and the nutty caramels. Real nice.-- bb

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Low but lasting creamy off-white head. Clear dark brown body. Sweet roasted malt cocoa nuts aroma. Citrus pine flavor with a good deal of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish.

Pours a deep ruby with a loose finger of off-white head diminishing rapidly to a thin skim and spotty lacing. Nose is caramel malt, floral and herbal hops, slight fruit. Taste follows suit, with caramel leading the way and a bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation, slick and slightly syrupy, with a dry finish.

Fairly middle of the road IPA, with a little more sweetness than I prefer. The floral/herbal hop profile is also less my preference than the pine/citrus side of the hop spectrum. That said, its a decent enough example of a hoppy red ale.

NOK 175 at Bøker & Børst in Stavanger. Fortunately not my round. Dark amber. Dense beige head. Aroma of bitter grape fruit and orange marmelande. Similar taste, with caramel. Bitter aftertaste. Well balanced.

Keg at Taps KL. It pours cloudy deep red with a thick light tan head. The nose is bitter-sweet, juicy pine, red fruits, mild toffee, pine needles and varnish. The taste is bitter, piney, varnish, leather, red fruits, caramel, pine needles, toast, alcohol hit, citrus peel, resin and pepper with a lingering bitter finish. Medium+ body and fine carbonation. Punchy and bitter. Very nice stuff.
Very malty ale and it tastes of dark Nelson hops. IPA with a good hop profile.

Shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Red beer, tan head. Nose is citric, caramel, malt, pine, woody notes. Flavor is fruit, citrus, caramel sweetness, malt, solid hoppy bitterness in the finish. Dry mouthfeel. Nice brew.

500ml bottle. Dark reddish brown with short-lived frothy white head. Beautiful aroma of orange, sweet caramel, chocolate. Soft on the palate with layers of taste starting with chocolate, bran ending with long hoppy finish. Tasty and complex. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark amber with off white head. Good head retention. Scent of hops, bread, and pine. Taste is hoppy, notes of caramel, vanilla, and pine with a trace of roasted coffee. Pine, caramel and coffee notes linger on palate. Strong carbonation, with a thick and rich mouth feel. Overall a pretty good brew.

Bottle at home from Drinkstore. Pours ruby red with tan foam head. Floral, herb hops aroma. Toffee, caramel, bread malt base with perfume. Sharp pithy bitterness. Carbonation a bit strong which leaves a long lasting dry aftertaste. Full flavour with slick mouthfeel. Good

0,5L bottle. Pours deep red with light tan head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is pine, malt and caramel. Taste is pine bitter, caramel, fruits, and malt. Finish is pine bitter and caramel. Overall: nice brew.

Bottle at Delirium. Massive caramel on the nose, with a good quantity of hops. More hops in the taste and especially the finish, but the caramel continues to dominate. Absolutely enjoyable beer, well balanced, but a bit too sweet for my taste.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy copper, woody, sweet, bitter, dry, very fruity, pine.
Bottle from Purvis. Lovely red colour, caramel, sweet, nice aroma. Another superb beer from these guys.

Lo tiene todo. Color precioso, vivo. Espuma estupenda, abundante y persistente. En el aroma y en el sabor hay caramelo y lúpulo resinoso y afrutado, intenso. Muy intensa en el polo maltoso-caramelo y en el lúpulo. Compleja y deliciosa, una de mis cervezas favoritas.

Red colouring with a light brown head. Aroma and taste are rich with caramel. Slight bitter aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Taps, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a crystal clear medium reddish amber with a long lasting frothy white head. The aroma is woody resin hop with caramel malt. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a huge resin hop light toothpaste palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A real hop fest.

Ambrée foncée, effervescence faible, mousse disparaît dans la seconde. Caramel très (trop?) présent, amertume plutôt forte, légèrement fruitée, belle présence dépices, un peu écoeurante sur la longueur.
Bottle at home. Pours dark red. Smells caramel and hoppy fresh. Taste is slightly bitter with medium body and medium carbonation. Very nice beer!
Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color ambar oscuro, casi rojizo. Sabor a lupulo, malta, ligeramente a caramelo.
Brown with small yellow cap. Sweet aroma. IPA taste with stouty caramel notes.

500ml Bottle. Dark amber in colour with a medium, excellently laced, off white/light brown head. Floral Aroma. Notes of citrus, malt, strawberries and caramel. Medium body with a average carbonation. Rich malty flavour with caramel notes, balanced with sweet, fruit flavours. Finish is long, bitter grapefruit flavour with hints of pine. Dry and bitter. A very nice red ipa, not sweet and not to malty, good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a bottle. Pours deep orange/brown with a quick disappearing head, some malt smoothness and the fruity hops up front.

500mL bottle from Dark Horse offie. Pours a reddish brown into the tulip glass. HUGE off white head that pillowed up and over the glass on first pour, took a good ten minutes to actually fill the glass. Lots of soapy lacing. Cinnamon, cold medicine, floral hops, Christmas pudding, fruitcake, loads of complexity in the aroma and flavor. Slightly astringent in the mouthfeel. Nice and unexpected.

Bottle into tulip glass. Beautiful pour.....could grace a beer book cover. It looks inviting, red, slightly off white head, nice clarity. Spicy, some toast, honey, OMG, the flavor surpasses the nose, apricot, sticky sweet hops, dough, following a long bitter finish. Creamy mouth feel. This is really quite superb!!

500ml bottle from Brewdog Online Store. Clear reddish amber colour, foamy biege head and aroma of sweet floral orange citrus & pine hop resin. Taste is sweet, malt caramel, pine, resiny, orange, spice, with an earthy grapefruit citrus hoppy bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, medium carbonation, spicy bitter finish. Well balanced, very drinkable.

Holy shit this is good stuff. Full frontal hops, piney, spruce, fresh and rich, backed by a solid malt body of light roasted, deep roasted and caramelised malts, each clearly present. Full flavour, perfect mouth feel. Solid bitterness, lasting to the bitter ;-) end. Delicious. (50cl bottle brought by Bertanne from De Molen)

Pours a dark red with small slightly tan head. Aroma of malt and slight hop presence. Tastes good with a strong malt Carmel character with nice hop bitterness. Probably the best India red ale Ive had.

Bottle from BrewDog mail order. Poured a clear, bright ruby colour, with thin, dense, off-white head. Aroma of brown sugar, bitter hops and caramel. Sharp, bitter pine needles in the initial flavour, mixed with some chewy malt and straw. Finish was very bitter resin, but in a good, rounded way with some golden syrup sweetness.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized creamy foamy head on top of a clear red amber colored beer.
Aromas of malts, hops, caramel, some hop fruit, grapefruit, peach, pine, some honey, some flowers, light resin, light spice tone, some toast and some smooth sweet bay leaf tints.
Flavours of bitters, herbs, leaves, hops, grapefruit, apricot, tea herbs, malts, caramel, toast, bread, yeast, light bay leaf, light spicy and some dough.
Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, herbs, toast, hops, light sticky, fruity and (dried) leaves.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to fuller bodied and a creamy texture.
Reminds me a bit of a Barley Wine, nice! Specially the aroma!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Excellent colour and great smell. Another very well balanced beer. Lots of caramel malt and big fruity hops
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a thin white head, very fruity aroma, the taste is light and hoppy with a dry fruity finish.

Bottle from Aeon Liquor! Aroma is biscuity malt, pink grapefruit, hint of booze. Taste is great, pink grapefruit is up front, maltiness is there too, bit of biscuit, caramel and light spiciness. Really easy to drink. No hint of the alcohol in the taste. Great stuff.

500ml Bottle. Dark amber in colour with a medium, excellently laced, off white/light brown head. Floral Aroma. Notes of citrus, marmalade and caramel. Hints of licorice and herbs. Rich malty flavour with caramel notes, balanced with sweet, fruit flavours. Finish is long, bitter grapefruit flavour with hints of pine, as well as spicy/licorice notes. Dry and bitter, with a slight sour hint. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation.

Irridescent copper. White head stays for the drink. Floral hoppy nose with a 60/40 split hop/malt distribution. Pure awesomeness to be enjoying this hoppy red craft ale at the Roundhouse in Hong Kong. A taste of Austin in the South Pacific.

Rating #977 - February 14, 2014 - #whattimeisititsvamlumtimes $7.99 for a 650mL bomber from Coop. Clear amber-reddish pour with a bubbly white head, sticky lacing. Aroma is a bucket load of floral, citrusy hops. Taste is mild caramel malty sweetness, with a powerful punch of hop textures. Medium carbonation, mild alcohol warmth, medium bodied. Lots of cool dry hop flavour in this one, very tasty.

Appearance: Clear ruby with 3 finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Pine, resinous, musky, grapefruit, marmalade, peppery, citrus pith, biscuit, hints of vinous and marzipan notes.
Taste: Medium sweet and bitterness with low/medium sourness.
Palate: Thick smooth texture, medium body, average carbonation, dry citrus bitter, sweet finish.
Comments: Very good and glass lace.

Very pretty red, glowing, with orange tints and lace. 
Lovely grassy hops with citrus, orange, grapefruit, caramel and light chocolate. Caramel, grass, orange. Very bitter. A bit more balanced.

Pours a deep amber from a 500 ml bottle. Mine had a gigantic foam head that left some lacing (unsure why as the other reviews indicated a minimal-no head). Aroma of sweet fruits and some malt tones. Taste is the same, citrus and fruit notes on the nose and malt tones as it goes down. Enjoying it but not as much as the hopwired due to the reduced hop and citrus notes in favor of the malt profile.

India Red Ale, 7% from Asahiya. Served in a half-pint glass. A hazelnut brown pour with a minimal beige head that dissipates fast leaving no lacing behind. The hop bouquet from this beer is a great new zealand tropical fruit punch nicely counterbalanced with a solid malt backbone. Fairly full bodied the taste is somewhat of a letdown with a ton of sour bitter grapefruit and some resiny pine nowhere near as complex as the nose, much simpler but even then some nutty caramel comes into play from the malts. Im not digging it, for me it is too much of a pithy grapefruit sour/bitter vibe. Well made but it just isnt coming together for me. I preferred the Hop Wired IPA by a wide margin.

2014-01-17. Lightly hazy dark red brown body, modest tan head. 3++ Flavour is pleasantly bitter, lightly leafy green hop character throughout. Aroma is similar moderate green hops character, mild malt base. Average palate suitable carbonation. Quite quaffable. Bit simplistic, compounded by it being later in the evening but pretty enjoyable regardless. Bottle via private order arranged by GregClow

Aroma :citrus hops with some rich maltiness

Taste :Strong hopiness off the bat that pair later witg a rich maltiness with caramel notes

Appearance : clear amber body with a well retained thin head

On draght at the Norfolk Hotel Freemantle. Deep red with a yellowy head. This Red IPA has complex caramel tones to give a soft balance against the huge hop load. The best of the 8 wired stable I've tried.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2014 Retaste - tap at The Norfolk - Biscuit malt dominant - enough hops to keep my interest - quite thick on the tongue with malty aftertaste. Tasty. A big beer which kicks sand in the face of lesser beers. Nice one even though not my preferred style - always quality from 8 Wired.

Pours a nice clear amber-brown with small white-ish head. Smell is highly floral with malt and some yeastiness. Tastes like a watered down version of the aroma, floral and malt that ends in dry bitter finish. Medium body with just enough slickness. Like a more floral, malty Rogue Dead Guy.

Pours a deep amber with a small but lasting head. Lots of fresh hops burst out of the glass, Lemon, grapefruit and some caramel malt. Taste follows through to what is a fairly typical IPA at the front, but carefully balanced on the back with smooth and subtle sweet malt, some grassiness. medium low carbonation is spot on with a fresh dry bitterness. Well crafted this one.

Smells like a maltier version of other 8wired beers - citrus, floral hops, sweet. Dark amber but not translucent. Taste starts off very hoppy and fruity and good, finishes quite bitter and malty. Quite good but not as good as hopwired or superconductor
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 Restrained tropical fruit aroma in a deep brown copper pour.  Sweet tasting alternative to a hop driven pale ale. Makes for a more interesting tasting session for sure.

65cl bottle from 1420, León. Pours hazy dark amber, with frothy off white head. Good head retention, some lacing. Malty, liquorice, herbal and caramel aromas. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is caramel, liquorice, malty, nuts, spicy. Dry bitterness, quite high. Dry aftertaste. Very enjoyable.

Couleur : ambre foncé, mousse épaisse. Nez : notes classiques de caramel qui se mêlent à des fruits rouges et noirs (cassis, framboise). Légèrement maltée et houlonnée. Bouche : comme au nez,notes de caramel, de torréfaction, de fruits rouges et une pointe dexotisme (mandarine ?). Quelques notes florales aussi. Finale : longue, très légère amertume (mais les 60IBU ne se sentent pas). Très fine, aucune lourdeur pour cette ambrée.

500ml bottle, dark amber-copper color, with a fluffy beige head, with a mild toasted, caramel, biscuity, bready malt, floral citrus, leafy, grassy, piney hop nose, with a light orange, lemon peel, subtle pine bark, toffee note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice toasted, caramelized, biscuity malt, good flowery leafy, grassy, piney, minty hoppy character, with some toffee, light lemon, grapefruit peel, lemon pie crust flavours, leading towards a grainy toasted caramel maltiness, intense lingering minty, grassy, citrus, piney hop bitterness finish.

Bottle - 500ml. Dark copper body with a good off-white foamy head. Robust hoppy aroma with malty, fruity, and cinnamon hints. Its sharp hoppy taste carries woody, brown sugar, and fruity notes. Ends with a long bitter finish. Well done.

The head is robust, the body red-brown. It smells bitter, aromatic, interesting, natural, forest, hoppy. Taste is hoppy-creamy, maltaromatic, hoppintensive, bitter, raisin, natural, bitter-aromatic, forest. 3.9

Rousse. Peu de collet. Nez: Houblon. Amer. Caramel brûlé. Café/végétale (poivron vert). Bouche: acre et végétale. Caramel. Belle amertume équilibré avec le côté malté. Céréales rôties. Finale sèche et amère.
bottle a amber colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy caramel earthy citrus some fruits and some hops flavor malts spicy caramel fruits citrus earthy and bitter hops

500 ml bottle. Unclear dark red copper, foamy tan head settles and mostly fades. Aroma is quite hoppy, herbal, floral, citric orange, with some caramel malt. Herbal, flowery, fruity and juicy hop taste, some pine resin and woodiness, balanced nicely with roasty dark caramel malt. Average carbonation, medium-full body, moderate-aggressively hopped. Quite the boozy bite for only 7%, though it softens and sweetens as it warms, but its still: DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)

Tasted a small sample at a BeerThief gathering. Pours up a red-orange and cloudy. Aroma is a fight between fruity hops and the malt. Taste is the same: bitter plus malt. My main impression of the beer is that it is very bright, big and solid throughout. Nice and dry in the finish. This is a very good beer!
Pours dark amber with tan head. Smells of hops, malts, and alcohol. Tastes of rich malts, hops, and roasted malts. Finishes clean with low/medium carbonation.
Light to medium red, small head. Full mouth feeling but not to much, fruity and dry, malty.
Floral tropical aroma, big caramel sweetness and some floral and citrus flavours. Well bodied.

Bottle 50 cl at Gothenburg Beer Festival 2013 (Haket), Sunday, sampled on September 8, 2013.Cloudy orange color, tan head. Sweet, malty scent. Malty, spicy, caramel taste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

500ml bottle. Slightly hazy copper pour with a HUGE lasting fluffy beige head. Smells a bit like a barleywine - leafy, boozy, dry and a bit peppery. Taste - yep, BW - very malty and floral, quite bitter, strong alcohol, but not quite as boozy as the aroma. Solid body and carbonation, dry pithy bitterness in a fairly long finish. Intense indeed.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Légère odeur de caramel et dhoublon. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée voilée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun énorme col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel et dhoublon résineux avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #5083)
Bottle @ GBF 2013. Reddish brown with a small tan head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, fruit, caramel and hops. Medium to full body with a dry finish.
Dark amber colour. Piney hop aroma. Flavour is caramel, bittersweet, piney hops.
500 ml bottle pours dark amber with tan head that settles well. Wow amazing floral hop aroma. Medium bodied and bitter with caramel sweetness coming through. Mouth watering. Nice

500 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits. Pours a murky dull amber colour with large, foamy eggshell head that recedes quickly. Aroma is caramel, dark fruit and resinous hops. Flavour is rich caramel, juicy fruits and resinous pine. Alcohol is a little more apparent than I might like. Good, but not great.

Bottle. So, another red ipa. Chestnut brown with a medium sized beige head, ok retention and lace. Tropical fruit; mango, lychee and caramel in the nose. Same notes in the aroma with some rye bread. Caramel at first then turns hoppy leading to a light dry finish, quite hoppy, medium body, medium everything, pleasant drink.

500ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Clear amber with med foamy head. Lots of lacing.

Aroma : Piny and resinous hops with caramel. 

Taste : .Light resinous and piny hops with caramel. Finish has piny hops with caramel. Toffee notes with a tiny hint of smoke.

Palate : Slightly strong carbonation.

Overall : Good. Nice caramel malt mixed with piny and resinous hops. The resinous notes could have been overdone and that would have been a show stopper for me but its not the case here. Fairly well balanced and drinkable. Well executed.

Bottle from Fish&Beer, Copenhagen - Hazy amber pour with a medium off-white head, and great lacing. Sweet fresh floral hops, some grass, pine, and herbal and woody nuances on the palate,along with some nutty, toffee, sweet caramel malts. Complex, and lovely balance of sweet and bitterness, great mouthfeel and finish. Gorgeous.

500ml bottle from the BrewDog bar in Leeds, thanks to Stefan for sharing. Decent off-white head with fine retention leaving spotty lacing behind. Clear ruby-brown coloured body. Aromas of dark fruits and semi-sweet malts. The taste character is made up by red orange, caramel malts and bittersweet citrus peels towards the ending. Medium bodied. Likable (session in Tromsø, 30.07.2013)
Very tasteful red ale. Maybe port brewing red ale was little bit better. First beer from 8 Wired but surely not last.

My Bottom Line:
Coniferous angles and earth-covered tree bark move into dried cranberries in this fluffy India Red Ale.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A tower of foam dwindles into the cloudy dark red.
-Carbonation is very high and expansive. Feels like a Belgian-style Ale, without the yeast signature, of course.
-The hops are as aromatic as they are bitter.
-Orange zest confit is tasted at the edges.
-Malts also share some discreet caramel.

Bottle.

Bottle. Red copper body, tall tan head. Aroma has sweet caramelly hops. Sweet and caramelly taste with plenty of bitterness. The hoppiness is dry and not too fruity. Lacks complexity. Their Saison Sauvin was much more delicate. Nice but it seems to have lost some freshness in the transit.
Dark red color, small head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, hops and some herbs. Taste is similar, dry sweet with nice bitter finish. Medium body and soft carbonation.
Bottle at The Bottle Shop Canterbury. Too sweet doesnt taste fresh no hops. Just like drinking sugar solution. Really bad. They swapped it for something else which I was really important with.

Brown bottle, 500 ml, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on July 10 2013; eye: caramel with an orangey hue, hazy, nice beige head made up of rather large bubbles, light lacing; nose: resinous hops, pine, malt, caramel, slight citrusy; mouth: resinous hops, pine, malt, caramel, nice astringency, dry finale in resinous hops with presence of malt, medium-full body, good carbonation, quite bitter, slightly sweet, harsh texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 10 juillet 2013; il : caramel avec une teinte orangée, voilée, bonne mousse beige formée de bulles plutôt grosses, légère dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, pin, malt, caramel, très léger citrique; bouche : houblon résineux, pin, malt, caramel, bonne astringence, finale sèche en houblon résineux avec présence de malt, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, pas mal amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture rugueuse; en résumé : bien
A softer red ale that brings the best of both worlds. Favourite red ale available so far.
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 One of the best red ales you could ever have. Exceptional beer, as only 8Wired can do. Great beer.

Bottle. Gushes a bit when opened, and pours a gleaming mahogany-orange colour with a massive creamy and rocky off-white head. Big aroma of sharp and fruity hops with strong caramel malt notes to balance. Big flavour as well, with caramel, orange toffee and a hint of coffee to start, followed quickly by a whallop of pine and citrus from the hops. Pretty damn nice.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This is a red-brown coloured beer with a very rich, slight sour, red fruity flavour, malt notes with smooth liquorice and blackcurrant on the bitter finish. Excellent!

500ml bottle, pours deep amber / red with foamy white head. Rich caramel malt backbone, with piney hops, a bit earthy and hints of citrus. Well balanced and smooth with sold carbonation. Very nice indeed.
Amber, white head, hops in aroma. Citrus, caramel and hops in taste. Decent beer.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a super large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of earthy hops notes with solid caramel malt backbone. Taste is also dominated by earthy hops with light citrus notes with some solid caramel malt with balanced sweetness level. Body is full with nice creamy texture and great carbonation with no apparent alcohol. Solid offering form 8 Wired.

Bouteille. Une robe ambrée avec un filet de mousse beige. Le nez est une ode au malt caramel / crystal, une chance quil y a du houblon pour contrecarrer les plans de ce caramel maléfique. En bouche  le liquide se défend bien, car les houblons viennent à la rescousse de tout ce caramel. Des levures fruitées complètent la marche. Très agréable, une sorte de bière destinée à lInde mais qui aurait Dublin comme ville de départ au lieu de Burton-upon-Trent ou Londres.

Caramel taste that does not overpower you; with a natural hoppiness.  This dark brown ale pours with a minimal head, and has a taste tending towards a pleasant bitterness.  A full body beer with lingering aftertaste.

Red-amber colour, with thick and slightly rocky head.  Earthy aroma with lots of crystal malt and some fruity hops that have at this point begun to fade.  Earthy character has lots of bitterness and rich crystal/caramel malt complexity.  Long finish is really only a little bit chewy.

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark amber with a huge offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, berries, fruity hops, peach. Flavor is malt, caramel, fruity hops, peach, sweet berries, light alcohol. Medium body, lively carbonation. 080513

Une bouteille partagée par rodenbach99.  Une bière totalement ambrée qui propose une tête imposante et bien tenace.  Un nez frappé par des notes de caramel foncé qui sont bien martelées par des notes de fruits rouges et par des houblons floraux et citriques.  Des saveurs maltées de biscuit et de caramel cristallisé.  Une indéniable dose de houblons à laméricaine : des goûts distinctifs de pin, de fleurs et de notes citronnées.  Un corps de moyenne densité dans lequel les bulles ont un comportement modéré.  Une texture qui mapparait huileuse.  Une finale qui présente de bonnes notes asséchantes et amères qui cherchent à sétendre dans le temps.  À bien y penser, cette bière me rappelle la Zoe.

Dunkles Bernstein mit kleinem Schaumkragen. Citrustöniges Hopfenaroma mit Grapefruit und Waldbeeren. Vollmundiger Antrunk. Würzig-erdiger Geschmack, semi trocken und leicht röstig obendrein. Klingt lange und angenehm bitter nach. Der Hopfen ist einfach geil!

bread, floral, caramel, citrus, red, cloudy, rocky head, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively. Very balanced. After drinking aroma turns more towards caramel. Very balanced and lots of things going on. Yet, very constraint in a way. Very well made

Looks awesome in the glass - clear russet red with bright red highlights and a thin beige head. Light carbonation. The nose is very hoppy, with some tropical fruit, dark caramel and rye bread. Pretty aggressive hop bitterness up front gives way to apple, mango, spice and a bit of lemon, marmalade and toast. Beautifully balanced. A really excellent beer.

This is a bit of alright, there is a truck loads of flavour and its all nicely balanced with bitterness. 

The aroma is spectacular, and after this sits in the glass it improves.  Easily a one of the most dirinkable beers Ive had for a while. But for all that its not that bitter, and I didnt get a head or a lacing that I thought I might.

Enjoyable though, you should too, its one of their better efforts.
Hops in the nose. Foamy pale beige head. Hazy red brownish color. Hops and chocolate and grapefruit in the taste. Nice color.

comes out of the tap beautifully red. very bright hops and an almost overpowering alcohol, which seems a bit out of place. was hoping for something special but aside from the hop bitterness everything else seems a bit muted, leaving it rather dry on the finish. flavours are nice though. not too bad but not as good as hoped.

Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff feb-12: den tredje av de fire vi prøvde fra 8 Wired. Disse gjorde det til en super aften, det ene høydepunktet ble avløst av det neste. Denne var litt uklar, ravbrun med mye skum, med aroma og smak som var preget av furunål og grapefrukt fra Warrior, Columbus, Simcoe, Amarillo. Tørr og bitter avslutning har Sigmund notert.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2013 500ml bottle from Glengarry Wines Takapuna. What a BIG beer this is. The mouth feel is so big, fat, round and creamy. Its a gorgeous, delicious beer, and refreshing. This is my first beer after a day of hard labour, I was wavering between having a sharp, clean pilsener first, or this. I chose this and it was a good choice.
The only thing that stops me giving this a higher score is, like one of the commenters before me said, the alcohol content is just a tad too high, but dont let that stop you from drinking this malty, hoppy elixir!
ReRate: Ive just had a very fresh bottle, the difference between this and a slightly older one is quite noticable. Older bottles are what I would consider typical red: they have dark fruit like raisins, alcoholic plums, xmas cake and caramel etc. This fresh one is more towards the typical NZ IPA style, lots of fruit on the nose and a taste that finishes pine. Either way, one of the best beers ever made.

Bottle courtesy of gethinbeer - many thanks! Deep amber pour with a thick off-white head. The aroma is slightly spicy but has a touch of oxidation that is quite distracting. A little bit of soft peppery character and a bit of light caramel malt. Assertively hopped with a woody sort of bitterness. I was expecting bright hoppiness - but its pretty muted. Perhaps a bit past its prime, but the oxidation just shouldnt be there.

Bottle, 7%. Slightly spicy aroma, smells like a rough bitterness. Almost clear red chestnut colour. Small stable creamy tan head. The flavour is nutty, slightly salty, boozy. Good clean bitterness. Too much alcohol in my opinion.
Bottle. Pours hazy ruby with smooth off-white head. Clear hoppy aroma with fruity and flowery notes. Bitter, hoppy atoma with a touch of flowers. Dry aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel. Decent.
Pours a dark red colour with a tall frothy off-white head. Aroma is quite malty, caramel, fruit and herbs. Taste is medium sweet leading to a fruity, caramel and hoppy finish. Great one.
Plenty of Crystal malts in this one. The description pretty much says what it is. Big yet refreshing. bold but balanced. Wouldnt mind having this one again.

Looking forward to this beer all week finished 7 night shifts and was up for something fresh, bitter and refreshing!
Poor was darker amber than expected pleasant thin head that laced the glass. Nice aroma of floral citrusy hops but not as intense as expected. 
Taste is full on though sharp and bitter there is no sign of that malt bitterness but Im enjoying that this really is all about the intense bitterness awake!  There is some floral, citrusy hop flavour and the malt balance is slowly making its way in but really the bitter sensation is the dominate factor that lingers nicely on the palate.
Really like it.

500ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga, MelnaZiema2013)
Russet red, tight head. Pleasant hoppy and red fruit aroma. Lots of walnuts in the taste, and tons in the finish too. Smooth palate, soft carbonation. Some tanginess. Nice citrus later. So full. Very pleasant.

A $9.50 12 oz glass at Tap and Mallet.   As expected, the hop taste comes through far better as the beer warms. Well malted up front, sauvignon hops are there mid sip.  Good drinkability.Slightly red appearance.

Röd/Brun i färgen, offwhite skum. Doftar grönt, fruktigt, citrus, karamell. Smakar härligt fruktigt, karamell, citrus, söt frukt, humle, lite vinöst. En riktigt bra balans mellan maltsötma och humlecitrus.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 ll Poppy - India Red Ale This is an ale that is not afraid of standing tall among other great beers. The intense, sharp and fruity hoppiness is backed by its complex, caramel-like malty structure. Big, yet refreshing. Bold but balanced. This beer has been designed to have it all, to be the greatest common denominator.

500 ml bottle. BBE 08/2013.
Pours a dark ruby brown colour with a white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, old hops and some biscuity notes. Flavour of strong sweet caramel, old but quite bitter hops again, dried fruits, grapefruit and biscuity malts. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a fruity, malty and light bitter finish. Not a fresh bottle unfortunately, yet good.
a nice red ale. hoppier than most ive tried. but still a good backbone. enticibg aroma. looking foward to trying the rest of their beers. seem to be popping up around australia
Cerveza color caoba. Con poca espuma, ligeramente cremosa. Olor acaramelado, con un sabor complejo. Muy buena cerveza.pp

Bottle. Redish brown color. Nice tan head, stays. Punch of hops, slightly sweet, oranges in aroma. Juicy, hops, faint yeast and fruity notes in flavor. It is very drinkable beer, but not exciting enough for me.
