Ruby-brown cream with fairly high carbonation. redcurrant and pines on nose. Very astringent caramalt and resinous hops quite fizzy and not my thing.

18-JAN-2012, bottle @ulkløbben meeting, @Henrik.
Amber (!) with huge, creamy, lasting, lacing, tan head.
Hoppy malty aroma. Bitter, grape fruit and pine. Taste the same with some dried and exotic fruits.
Very creamy, short aftertaste. Overcarbonated. Fine brew.

19th July 2011Hazy dark amber beer, good pale cream coloured head. Softish palate, fine carbonation. Slightly dry. Nice creamy malt base, smooth. Great piney hops with lesser orange and grapefruit. Trace of mango. Finishes creamy and semi dry. Well joined up. Sweet peach in the finish as well!

from Erzbierschof - clear reddish beer with a little but persistent foam; hoppy aroma of red fruits marmalade; notes of raisins and cream; a good malt backbone and a subtle but fair carbonation; a decent bitterness, quite dry with long notes of caramel and more red fruits hoppiness - very drinkable and charming

500ml bottle. Red brown colour, hazy, moderate off-white. Aroma is piney and grapefruit hops with some candy malt. Taste is much the same. Medium body. Overall, it is what it says it is, a red ale hopped like an IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gedronken bij dutchdrebus, bij het inschenken valt de grote vaste schuimkraag meteen op. Bruine kleur. Ruikt fris, hoppig en zoet. Smaakt vol, hoppig, zoet.

Bottle @ home, shared with the gf. No matter how slow you pour it, a huge, dense, lasting white head will form. The head doesnt shrink.. Im getting thirsty. The beer itself is hazy amber coloured. Smells some orange peel, hops, slightly sweet, slightly grapefruit, malts. Tastes mandarin, slightly chocolate, some hops, malts and even a bit roasty. Quite a special combination of flavours. Thin to medium body, soft carbo.

(Bottle) Lovely looking beer: clear ruby tinted brown with big beige head. Subtle but very nice aroma of fruit (stone fruit). Medium bodied and quite well carbonated giving very good mouthfeel. Well balanced flavour starting with nice combination of rich toffee caramel maltiness and fruity tang transitions to an assertive but very nice hoppy bitterness which persists for a long finish. An impressive beer.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear light brown with a red tinge, pine hop aroma, toffee taste with a small amount of hop reminds me of a poor version of Hop Rod.
500 ml bottle deep red in colour nice hoppy aroma very hoppy flavour low carbanation very smooth top drop

500ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy burnished copper colour, with a large light beige head, which lasts very well, and leaves reasonable lacing. The aroma blends potent resin hops with some fruity berry notes and some nutty, roasty malt notes. Strong pine resin up front softens into a delightful slightly sweet berry flavour. This is followed by a firm backbone of dark nutty malt, with some toast notes. The finish mixes pine hops with mild berry fruit. This is a very lovely beer. It is complex and interesting, with a nice mix of flavours, yet still very drinkable. Im really enjoying 8 Wireds beers, and this is the best of those I have sampled.

500ml bottle from Ales by Mail
Batch 73, BBE Mar/14 - 
Pours dark reddish brown color with a large foamy head. Aroma of toffee, caramel malts, hints of lemon and grassy hops. Taste is quite malty and heavy on caramel and toffee notes. Hints of hops and ripe fruits. Finish is hoppy and bitter with some ripe fruitness and malty caramel notes. Okay, quite malty and caramely amber ale. Feels like this is missing something (probably not a very fresh bottle?).

Bottle - Sweet fruit and floral hops.  Cloudy amber with a nice rich head. Very mild bitterness and a fruity sweetness.  Cherries and hops, very unusual but it works.  I would not mind drinking this again.

Bottle from bottle-shop.co.ukOrange and grapefruit right out of the bottle. Massive orangeish head. Aroma is grapefruit, citrus fruits, earthy/grassy notes, hops all the way, fresh and tempting. Orange peel appears later. Colour is hazy deep amber-brown. The taste is initially caramel malty. Citrus fruits, grapefruit, exotic fruits. The hops profile is very balanced, this beer is TASTY. Smooth and not at all agressive. Foamy. Finish is long, hoppy, dry. Extremely drinkable.
Darker amber ruby colour, pours with nice creamy medium head. Smells like hops, caramel and malt. Tastes of bold hops and malt and caramel. One of my favourites...been back 10 or so times.

Dark brown with a creamy, light tan head. Sweet, malty, caramel and citrus aroma. Fruity, good persistent bitterness, creamy caramel fudgey taste. This is great - loving what Ive had from this brewery so far
Great aroma of hop fruit and gimmy bears. Lovely mahogany colour with a clinging lace. Malt syrup hop fruit. Delicious beer. Thick oily texture. Sweet caramel finish.

Keg @ CBC Clerkenwell. The pours deep amber with a large off-white head. Attractive beer. The nose is of raspberry jam, rich chewy malts, some harvest fruits. Big, expressive aromas. The taste is more bright, sugary raspberry and strawberry jam, hints of tobacco and wood. Nice bouncy caramel malts. Vibrant flavors. Medium body, active carbonation. Overall, really nice stuff.

Red and clear brew. Another huge beer in terms of aromas, hoppy notes are met with roast and caramel. on the palate i love how the super hoppy notes are countered with big caramel and malted notes with a hint of grain. Very structured and super tasty !

500ml bottle. Minimally cloudy reddish amber colour with huge, frothy, lasting, lacing, off-white head. Caramel malty aroma with a nuttily touch, hoppy overtones with notes of mustard and horseradish. Taste is caramel malty with slightly citrusy hoppy overtones, fruity notes of orange, grapefruit, bitter orange.

Pours a beautiful reddish brown with nice off white head that leaves behind a nice lace. The smell is of dried fruit, malty/nuttiness . Taste brings a nice light pine bitterness, dried fruit and nuttiness. Great balanced beer, the world could use more reds like this.

Pours a reddish brown color with a big frothy light brown head. Has great retention and awesome lace. Smells of citrus hops, floral notes and some nuts. Taste is malty and nutty up front with a nice mouthful of hops on the finish. All flavors blend together very smooth and no hint of the 7 point abv.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. 2 for $20 special get around it. Pours dark copper with a frothy solid beige head which holds nicely. Nose is quite strong has caramel, malts, citrus and pine hops with even a hint of booze. Taste is heavy on the dark fruits, malts and pine hops. Nice bitterness on the back end finishes it off beautifully. Exceptional beer.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear rusted red colour with tan head that sticks a little. Slight roast and caramel on the nose with some resinous hops. That resinous hop profile plays heavy on the palate with lots of caramel behind it. Finishes with a solid bitter crunch that lingers.

50cl bottle from Geers, BB 03/2014.
Cuivrée, col épais crémeux, blanc cassé.
Arôme est fleuri, senteur houblonnée, malt caramel, léger citronné avec ajout possible de houblon zélandais allant vers un raisin blanc, citronné. Côté malt reste sur un simple pâle, caramel.
Palais est houblonné et malté, sec et grillé assez poudreux avec un profile de fin de bouche citronné/agrumes frais sur pamplemousse et ce côté thé vert presque orangé. Malt reste en retrait ajoutant un léger caramel. Amertume reste brève mais contribue en grande partie au profile de la bière, surtout au niveau citronné.

Tap at the Cask, Pimlico - 22/10/12.
Lightly hazed russet brown with red tinges and a thin off white head.
Sweet caramel malt nose, pine, a little spice, apple and a hint of booze.
Taste follows nose.
Medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a bitter finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: OCT 21, 2012 On 50 cl bottle at Cardinal.
Aromas of hops ( grapefruit), high fruitiness - malty notes.
Good carbonation.
Medium body & medium / high complexity . Good bitterness, some sourness- very well balanced.
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
this is the IPA to have when you dont want an IPA dark red hops on  the nose complex malt and fruitiness very thirst quenching

Decent though overrated amber.  As expected, the hop taste comes through far better as the beer warms. Well malted up front, sauvignon hops are there mid sip on, something more subtle for this style. Good drinkability.Slightly red appearance.

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with large retentive head. Aromas of malts and caramel, with notes of citrus, light pine, and dark fruit. Very similar though more pronounced flavors, especially on the hops. Nice, though catching a bit of a  funny resin taste and definite acidity on the finish.

Moderate to heavy hops on the nose, along with herbs, pine, resin and grapefruit. Nicely balanced with moderate toasted, caramel malt. Pour is a ruby red/brown with a smallish creamy, off white, mostly lasting head. The middle is where this beer shines, with a light to moderate caramel sweetness, once again balanced by a light to moderate bitter hoppiness. Palate is excellent, medium bodied, creamy (a touch oily even) soft carbonation and an average, not overlong finish making this very drinkable. Another excellent beer from arguably NZs best and most consistent brewery.

I dont know why but I love the viscosity and mouthfeel of 8 Wired beers. I think thats largely what sets them apart. Feels like hop resins and heavy malts. The aroma was fruity, as expected from a hopped New Zealand beer, and theres woodiness in the malts taste as it blends with the hop bitterness. Superbly balanced!

500ml bottle. Pours dark red-brown with coffee head. Malty nuts and hops on the nose with some grassy floral hops. Taste is somewhat bitter and sharp, with a small amount of earth, and plenty of floral type tastes.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors clear red/amber with strong foamy head. 
Aroma malts, honey, dark ripe fruits, caramel,
Taste good bitter, some honey sweet, 
Mouth-feel creamy/thin. 
Great beer!

28/VIII/2012 50cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a (2012-977) 
Clear red to purple beer, big frothy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet malts, honey, lots of ripe fruits, bit soapy, some exotic fruits, caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium body. taste: very fruity, malty, sweet ripe fruits, some honey, bit floral, is it Nelson Sauvin in this one? bitter touch, some grapefruit. Aftertaste: very fruity, sweet malts, little soapy, nice bitter touch, bit grassy, fruity ending, pretty bitter.

Bottle from King&Godfree. Great mixture of flavours. Aromas of caramel, grass, and vinegar. Taste is sweet, bitter, and sour; with long length. Palate is velvety, with a medium-to-full body. Copper colour, with a frothy head.

Bottle, consumed during my inauspicious FFL auction draft. Deep red-orange colour, nice fruity sweet hop aroma, mostly stonefruits and melons. Sugary sweet caramel in equal partnership with fruity hops, ending in a well-balanced bitterness. I enjoyed this entire bottle, but I did not enjoy some of my draft outcomes. How the fuck did I end up with Ben Rothlesberger?
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours a deep clear reddish mahogany with a moderate creamy head with great retention. Beautiful hoppy and sweet aroma, dark fruits and citrusy bitterness - wonderful! Strong malt flavour - plums, light molasses (fancy) and dark caramel with a fresh citrusy/piny hop finish. Good carbonation, moderate body. Really really nice!
Bottle.Dark amber colour with off beige head.Aroma is sweet fruity and tosted with flavor of caramel,riped berrys and tosted malt,fruity and well balanced with hint of dried fruits and malt.

Huge, coffeecream-coloured head over (cold)hazed ruby-amber beer. Mix of cakey, caramelly malts and fragrant, fruity C-hops. Serious bitterness, ultimately hoppy, but with an equally serious malty, nearly syrupy underbuild. The sweetness of this, however, doesnt stand a chance. Orangepeel, orangemarmalade-filled cake, resiny as well. Well-carbonated, rather full bodied, very slick to viscous. Bitterness makes it refreshing. Very accomplished brew, but nothing really new.  Amber ale? Whatever. A USA brewer would have called this black IPA...
Sparkling mahogany,thick beige head.Nose of hops & rich malt.Light sweet fore,full bodied. Nice bitter hop profile, long hop finish. Nice , with good balance

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Tumbler de ½ pt. Saboreada en agt´12. Colro ámbar rojizo y apariencia algo velada. Espuma marfil de burbuja pequeña y corona sólida. En nariz aromas de resina y maltas tostadas con notas de pomelo. Resinas y malteado intenso al primer sorbo seguido de un ascendente amargor de lúpulo. Cuerpo medio-ligero y carbonatación suave. Largo final malteado con lúpulos subyacentes. Leve madera en el retrogusto. Vale la pena probarla.
500ml bottle. ½ pt Tumbler glass. Enjoyed on agt´12. Reddish amber color. Chill haze. Off-white, small size bubbled froth. Firm crown.  Resiny, toasted malt aromas & grapefruit notes to the nose. Resins & heavy maltiness at first sip followed by increasing hoppy bitterness. Medium to light body. Soft carbonation. Underlying hops in a long malty finish. Slightly woody on the aftertaste. Worth to try.

500mL bottle, pours a deep dark amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of mild citrus hops, caramel and biscuity malt, some perfumey floral notes in there as well. Flavour is quite hoppy, with the perfumey floral hops, slight citrus hops, and a big caramel malt backing. Pretty heavy feel on the palate, with a medium complexity. Finishes floral and slightly fruity. The more I drink, the more annoying that perfume quality becomes... Good, but flawed.
Murky brown colour. Big hop aroma with raspberry and black currant. Complex fruity taste. Lovely beer.
UPDATED: JUL 29, 2012 Bottle @ BrewDog Glasgow. Muddy brown with reasonable head. Sweet hoppy aroma & flavour. Dry citrus hop aftertaste. Well balanced & really good.

500 ml bottle. Pours a clear amber with a medium off white head. Aroma is very fruity with pronounced hop notes that evoke mango, pineapple and passion fruit. Flavour is quite fruity with citric hops, berries and mango. Excellent.

Dark ruby colored pour. Big off-white head that slowly falls, revealing a trail of light lacing behind. A sweet tea and hop aroma. Taste is similar. Slightly tannic with a little bit of maltiness and hops. A little bitter, but balanced by a nice bready maltiness. Very good.

Bottled. Reddish amber colour with a small foamy off-white head. Aroma is floral hops, some honey, mild grass and quite caramelly and toffeeish. Mild wooden and herbal notes as well. Flavour is quite caramel malty, toffeeish, mild crisp maltyness as well as some fruity and floral hops with a nice wooden and herbal note coming in as well. Wellbalanced and refreshing. Easy to drink and hides the 7 % abv well.

500mL bottle to flute
Pours a deep opaque red with a 1cm tan head. Citrus and piney hop aroma with nice caramel malts and slight alcohol too. Pine and grapefruit upfront with a nice balance from the malts. The alcohol is a bit distracting. Mouthfeel is oily and ending a bit watery because of the alcohol burn. A nice hoppy red, but probably too much alcohol.

Great beer. Pours out a dark ruby red, mostly opaque body with a thin head of dark beige. The nose is sweet and resinous with a big toffee and caramel malt. Beautiful citrus and tropical fruit hops with an overall fantastic balance. The flavor is well balanced as well with a tasty, full bodied caramel malt, lightly roasted with a fruity hop bomb late on the finish. Not overly bitter, but fantastic flavor.Overall, amazing amber.

50 cl. bottle. Clear, deep copper colour with a small off-white head. Aroma with lots of hops: Citrus and floral notes, also a solid impression of malts - lots of caramel malts, some honey, also a slightly toasted note. Taste is bitter, but with a significant impact from the malts. Medium body with a creamy texture, average carbonation. Long lasting bitter finish, with a lot of floral and citric hops, also a good amount of caramel malts, honey and a toasted note. This beer is not an explosion of floral hops as the outstanding HopWired IPA, however still an excellent beer.

Poured out a deep mahogany brew with a small tan head with dissipating ropy lacing. Smelling nice with a near prefect combo of mellow caramel, citrus, grapefruit, mild pine, very fruity and thick on that front. Very good and, well, basic. Tasty but not as good as the aroma. More bitter than it needed to be but thats the plan here obviously. The pine hits first and is subdued but the malt which is mellowed by the fruits. Unsweetened grapefruit, nectarine skin, more pine and the faintest of heat bite. Pretty good caramel and sweet fruit - nothing sugary at all. Good bite, carbonation that isnt an issue. Pretty good but the 9.50$ is totally insane.
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours reddish amber with a decent off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is caramel malt, fruity and piney hops, and spices. Taste is caramel malt and piney hops.

Pint at beer revolution. Nice light amber with an airy crayola crayon "skin color" cap. Pleasant malt nose with dry, crisp grapefruit. Taste is actually a trailing hoppy vinegar. Weird. But prominent taste is a balanced spice, hoppy malt. Yeah. Get what you want outta that aces review.

Another 8 wired winner! Pours a beautiful colour with a fantastic nose. This is a great take on an amber. As with most of the 8 wired  range, would thoroughly recommend it. Its only drawback is the price: AUS $14.

500ml brown bottle. Deep red brown pour, airy tan head with a rocky top. Small patches of clingy foam sticks to the glass. Nose is citrusy, fruity, caramel malts in back. Taste has caramel malts, quick fruitiness and some sweetness up front, good balancing citrus hop flavour - some lemon and grapefruit.. Lingering citrusy bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation. Easy drinking hoppy amber.

Pours a hazy dark amber colour with a fair tan head. Sweet and fruity aroma with spices and pinewood notes toguether with some citrus. Malty taste with some subtle notes of caramel. Medium sweetness and  medium bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation and a very nice dry mouthfeel long bitter finish. Very good.

Bottle. LA will win the cup but I still end up second in my pool. Dark red with fair head. Nice malty aroma with noticeable hops. Woody red hoppy flavour. Nice and drinkable. Not extreme just strong flavours and drinkable.

Bottle at home, from my Minneapolis Town Hall glass. Pours deep ruby red, with a garnet hue. Nose is dense grapefruit, tropical fruit, some pine, sweet caramel, really nice smelling Amber! Flavours of smoky red berries, caramel, grapefruit hops, nice bitterness, which plays well off the sweetness. Not great but very good. Would have again happily.

500ml bottle pours a rich amber color with a small off-white head that leaves a few spots of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is pleasantly fruity with some mild hops.  Taste is a caramel malty sweetness and some light fruits balanced nicely with a bold spicy hop bitterness.  Medium bodied with nice carbonation.  One of the better amber ales that I have sampled, just very enjoyable.
No where near as popular as the Hopwired, but to me this is more the real deal.  Softer hops and a richer and fuller flavour.

Bottle at Henrik. Has a hazy brown colour with a medium light beige head. Fruity hops in the aroma along with berries, red currants, raspberries, and peaches. More touch of forest in the mouth with berries, wild berries, wood, grass, hops, pine and alcohol. Medium bitterness, and a soft mouth feel. A nice balanced mixture of flavours in this ale.

Bottle. Lovely red hue. Good hop aromas. Initial taste of sweet malt flavours but balanced off with good hop bitterness. A big beer, but not over the top.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is fruit, hop, grapefruit, citrus. Flavour is hop, peaches, malt, grapefruit, fruit, pine, caramel, citrus. bitter finish. Nice beer.

Good beer made by some good barstards.

Went down well with some good hawkes bay sun.

Sharp!

50cl bottle shared with Joes. Hazy red color, small off-white colored head. Smell hops and citrus. Taste malts, hops, citrus, flowers and some bitter though not that much. Pretty nice. Medium carbonation, medium body.

Shared 500 ml bottle at Cardinal. A three fingers thick, light brown, foamy head leaving good lacing over a clear, deep orange body. Wood, flowers, malts and herbs on the nose. Malty sweet, medium bitter light grassy flavors. Smooth to drink and a light syrupy texture. Medium to full body. Finishes on a dry tongue.

Shared bottle @ Cardinal. Pours as expected a nice tan head, dark amber in color. Aromas of clean hops and "biscuity malts". Tastes of caramel, nice hops. Nice bitterness. Smooth to drink and very appealing.

(Bottle, 0.5 l - BBE Jul 12, 20120209) The beer poured quite red and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had hops, citricness, malts and mildly molasses. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were hops, fruitiness, pine, malts, mild roastedness and medium bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, malty and bitter. Very good combination of hoppiness and maltiness. Really good brew.

Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours dark amber/red with a big creamy light tanned head.Aroma of fruity hops and bready malts. Taste is fresh fruity and piney hops with some grassy and berries notes. Good balanced, smooth and moreish, lots of caramel sweetness to take the bitter edge of this beer.

Bottled 500ml (Pikkulintu)
Deep amber-red color, small off-white head. Flowery, trefoil, sweetish, honeyish aroma. Medium-bodied. Caramel, flowery-fruity hoppyness. So it is sweetish, but not too much - balance is just right. Good brew. My first beer from Renaissance Brewing. Now would like to get more.

500 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7%. Cloudy amber to brown colour, large and creamy off-white head. Lovely aroma of fruity (particularly grapefruit) and piney American hops (Warrior, Columbus, Simcoe, Amarillo). The flavour is distinctly piney and resinous, the hops immediately take command of the malts in the background. Not very sweet, dry and bitter finish.
Probably a high quality beer, but definitively too bitter for me. Too bad...

500 ml bottle @ Patricks. Hazy, reddish body with a big off-white head. Aroma is refreshing citric fruity, pine and grass. Flavor is nice and fruity, bitter and some caramel malt. Medium body. Aroma is really nice on this one and a pleasant bitter aftertaste. Otherwise just really nice without really having anything special to offer. Sometimes thats just good enough.

Bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a clear dark red body with a sizable pillowy white head. So beautiful. :-) Nose is light strawberry tones, herbs and hints of grass. Fresh and nice. Taste is strawberry again, pine and red berries with hints of mint and pale malts. Soft and quite pleasant carbonation level, semi-slick mouthfeel. Simple and nice, yet very original. Definitely my favorite this far from 8 Wired.
Bottle. Red to brown with foamy white head. Hoppy as all get out. Tropical bubblegum. An impressive beer. Great hop profile and a tremendous maltiness. Good gear.

Pours a dark amber colour with a big white head and an amazing aroma of sweet berries (cherry)... hard to pin down but its familiar some how. It is backed by a godsmacking flavour of cherry brandy/hop resin and an amazing backbone of caramel malt. With each sip i am falling in love with this beer a MUST try.

Bottle passed onto me by Jan & Charlotte, many thanks to a very generous couple. Consumed 04.01.12    Fruity and tangy with a big malty back up. Nice aftertaste bitter and a little pithy fruitiness, hoppy but also a little nutty. Very dry at the end, great beer, pours red amber with large off-white head.  A6 A4 T8 P4 Ov15  3.7

Amazing colour, a dark red amber with a small bubbly off white head that lasts and lasts. Smells of typical NZ hops with a great malt backbone. Has a hint of passionfruit in the aroma as well. Some sweet fruits front up, passionfruit, toffee. Has an amazing malt backbone throughout, which accommodates the hop profile perfectly. Great bitterness to finish off the beer and make it last and last in your mouth. Overall a phenomenal brew

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2012 Bottle. Reddish Brown haze. Two finger foam. Plenty of fresh grass, pine and citrus. Good rounded body. Well Well balanced dry-bitter taste with moderate finish. Again very surprised; the third highscore brew in a row from this brewer. My favorite brewer this year. Cheers.
Bottle from Vinens Verden. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, caramel, malt and nuts. Nice long bitter finish.

Pours a cherry brown colour, a bit cloudy. Very little head, disappears immediately. In the aroma I get sweet malt, berries and bubblegum. In the flavour there seems a slight toasty charachter, caramel, boysenberries too??, lots of hop bitterness, I get the metal flavour that others have mentioned. Bitterness is pronounced and lingers, something mildly unpleasant about it.

Bottle.  Brownish beer with a strong frothy off whiteish brown head.  The aroma is very lightly hopped, and the flavour is very well hopped with a hefty bitter and dry finish.  Overall not a too bad well hopped beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer is on the heavy side of an amber ale, and the malt seems heavier and more complex than your average red ale. 8 Wired really is one to watch. Man, their beers are good.
